newsitem.title: USA: US Plains cattle market quiet, no sales - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: US Plains cattle market quiet, no sales - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle markets near midday Tuesday remained quiet, with no reported sales, feedlot sources said.
Packers were bidding $65.00 per cwt, but the bids were passed by owners who were pricing cattle at $67.00 to $68.00, sources said.
Cattle feeders' pricing stances were tied to ideas that packer demand will be strong this week to fill retail beef orders for planned features the next two weeks.
Expectations for firm cattle prices also were sparked by light cattle weights compared with a year ago, sources said.
